title: Update packages & Rust 2021
body: Update packages. Update docs. Remove nightly requirement. Update CI. Remove nix files. Add rust-toolchain.toml.

title: Update ipfs-embed and iced
body: Iced now supports copy in addition to paste, and ipfs-embed should have a better chance of go-ipfs interop.

title: Switch from Mutex to RwLock
body: RwLocks are similar to Mutexes, but it allows the program to have better information as to when the data should be locked. I wonder if there are even better data structures that allow for better data parallelism than a RwLock + BTreeMap to use for thumbnails when it comes to parallel processing, but this is a good start. Seems to shave off about 0.1-0.2s when processing around a thousand thumbnails with my test data set.

title: Streaming Thumbnails
body:
Let's put this back. I learned a few valuable things when experimenting with Rayon, and I think the streaming approach will offer better scalability and flexibility.

![Screenshot from 2021-01-22 06-16-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285690/105495531-852c4000-5c79-11eb-833b-22bee668ee85.jpg)

title: 67 Thumbnails - Rayon
body:
I went back to Rayon because even though it's not streaming, it works about twice as fast and doesn't feel as janky. It's also a much simpler design. That said, I learned a lot of really good things from my experiments with Iced subscriptions and parallel stream processing, so I left the old code in thumbnails.rs, just unused.

Related: #67
Closes: #21

title: Nix build WIP
body:
Enables nix builds. In the future, nix build needs to be added to CI and a Cachix server.

This was initially started to explore building with a musl backend and a glow frontend.

Musl works now, but glow does not. See:

https://github.com/hecrj/iced/issues/674#issuecomment-761164182
https://github.com/hecrj/iced/pull/354#issuecomment-635560478

The cargo2nix issue for building to the musl target was fixed, however:
https://github.com/cargo2nix/cargo2nix/issues/149

There is code in the last few commits that reverts both the musl target back to linux-gnu, and glow back to wgpu. Musl works, but doesn't find the graphics adapter on my machine. Glow OpenGL support is needed, in that case.

title: Perf and Clippy CI
body:
Closes #69 #65 #77 #78

Thanks, @goller !

title: ci: clippy now fails CI for any warnings
body:
Closes #69 

This adds a pretty strict clippy to github actions as well as fix up any clippy problems in the code.

title: N1gh7 m0d3
body:
Currently dark mode is active by default, toggle changes to light mode.  Currently working on issues with toggling back again (it don't), and getting the buttons included in theming.

Closes #4

title: Temporarily override 1MB size limit with usize::MAX.
body:
Resolves #55 (for now).

A better solution will arrive later. Also, adding a 17MB file is incredibly fast. I'll probably try with bigger soon enough.

Also, me being super curious about performance, I download this image and try adding it:
https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:The_Garden_of_Earthly_Delights_by_Bosch_High_Resolution.jpg

These are the results:

![Screenshot from 2021-01-06 10-47-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285690/103802985-2cb83a00-500d-11eb-89c3-23adb5c11eb1.png)

Basically, it adds and loads very quickly, but it's also too large to be displayed by what's needed to view it.

I did also try an enormous .txt file I had sitting around. That worked just fine:

![Screenshot from 2021-01-06 10-49-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/285690/103803012-3641a200-500d-11eb-9750-4332d9fd2c4f.png)

Not terrible!

title: Optimize byte slice reference encoding for DagCborCodec
Separate StorageService and NetworkService initialization
body: Refactor StorageService and NetworkService initialization separately to more easily alter configuration from defaults, and have a reference that can be passed to other methods. These references are then passed to the ipfs_embed `Ipfs` initializer, rather than relying on defaults.

title: Update iced to latest git revision. Update crates.
body: Gonna merge this and hold off on work on the P2P VPN until later. libp2p is almost there, I think, we should spend our time elsewhere.

title: Content handling cleanup & fixes
body:
Finally got this to work. I forgot to decode the data after being retrieved from IPFS before trying to pass that to the Iced image renderer.

This also includes some minor cleanup and improvements made while investigating other things.

I think I'm going to close the other PRs for now.

title: Add milestones document
body:
We're off to a great start! Let's keep this momentum going. Any comments and suggestions welcome!

Also, please note, this is a little unprioritized. This allows us to prioritize more flexibly as things change and development progresses.
